45 government staff working on conservation outcomes for a total budget of just over F$1 million. There are more than twice as A1:AS204 people (103) working for NGOs in Fiji with a total budget of just under F$12 million. In total, there are at least 23 organizations and six community organizations. NGOs with an annual budget of greater than half a million Fiji dollars are WCS, Birdlife International, Greenpeace, Live and Learn, IUCN and WWF. Other significant funding players are Packard, Moore and MacArthur Foundations and the Critical Ecosystems Partnership Fund.

Other represents LIFE spending. Additionally, NGOs spend approximately 1.2 billion pounds annually on biodiversity within the UK, representing approximately a 50% increase over public spending (2000-2006, DEFRA 2007), but this was not included in analysis because similar information is not available globally.

Other has been left blank because of lack of consistent information, but there are large investments by civil society. Halpern et al. (2006) lists $757m (2002/3 only) in spending by a combination of The Nature Conservancy, IUCN, WCS, World Bank and GEF. Since the GEF and the World Bank do not provide important funding for conservation projects inside the USA, this figure must represent spending by the first three organizations and in particular by TNC.
